posts._title: Franco Maresco – Belluscone. Una storia siciliana (2014)
posts.title: Belluscone Una storia siciliana
posts.excerpt: The film critic Tatti Sanguineti arrives in Palermo to find out what has happened to Franco Maresco’s unfinished movie: Belluscone. Una storia siciliana. A film that was supposed to tell the story of the unique relationship between Berlusconi and Sicily through the misadventures of the Palermitan impresario of Neapolitan “neomelodic” singers and organizer of street …

posts._title: François Dupeyron – Monsieur Ibrahim et les fleurs du Coran AKA Monsieur Ibrahim (2003)
posts.title: Monsieur Ibrahim et les fleurs du Coran
posts.excerpt: n a street called Blue in a very poor neighborhood in Paris, Monsieur Ibrahim (Omar Shariff) is an old Muslin Turkish owner of a small market. He becomes friend of the teenager Jewish Moises, tenderly nicknamed Momo (Pierre Boulanger), who lives with his father in a small apartment on the other side of the street. …

posts.title: Fit
posts.excerpt: Synopsis: Fit, Athina’s first short film was a finalist for the Student Academy AwardsTM. In this short film she explores a new kind of visual and corporeal language, deploying off-beat mise-en-scene, startling gestures and outlandish humor to vividly render the protagonist character’s struggle against her appointed familial, societal and professional role.

posts.title: Der Himmel uber Berlin
posts.excerpt: Plot Outline : Quote: This Wim Wenders film centers around the story of two angels wandering in a mixture of post-war and modern Berlin. posts._title: Mads Brügger – Det røde kapel AKA The Red Chapel (2009)
posts.title: Det røde kapel
posts.excerpt: A witty and controversial documentary from Zentropa, which won the SUNDANCE World Cinema Jury Prize in 2010. Quote: A journalist with no scruples and two Danish/Korean comedians—one a self-proclaimed “spastic”—travel to North Korea under the guise of a cultural exchange. posts._title: Nuri Bilge Ceylan – Kis uykusu AKA Winter Sleep [Extras] (2014)
posts.title: Kis uykusu
posts.excerpt: This is the “Bonus Disc Extras” of Memento Films’ BD release of “Winter Sleep”. Bonus Disc Extras includes: Behind the Scenes (2:18:56) in Turkish with French soft-subs. Winter Sleep at Cannes (0:10:35) in French & English Trailer (00:01:40) (no subs)
